data.enText: to deal successfully with sth difficult

data.chText: 到了这个阶段，我已经无法应付了。
data.enText: I got to the stage where I wasn't coping any more.

data.chText: 对付这项工作的紧张与压力，他无能为力。
data.enText: He wasn't able to cope with the stresses and strains of the job.
Desert plants are adapted to cope with extreme heat.

data.chText: （圣职人员在特定礼仪中穿的）斗篷式祭衣，大圆衣
data.enText: a long loose piece of clothing worn by priests on special occasions

means: (圣职人员在特定礼仪中穿的)斗篷式祭衣

tr: worn by a priest or bishop on ceremonial occasions
brick that is laid sideways at the top of a wall

example: We got by on just a gallon of gas
They made do on half a loaf of bread every day

value.def: If you cope with a problem or task, you deal with it successfully.

example.ex: It was amazing how my mother coped with bringing up three children on less than three pounds a week...
example.tran: 我妈妈用每周不到3英镑的钱抚养大了3个孩子，简直太不可思议了。

example.ex: The problems were an annoyance, but we managed to cope.
example.tran: 这些问题很讨厌，但是我们都设法解决了。

value.def: If you have to cope with an unpleasant situation, you have to accept it or bear it.

example.ex: Never before has the industry had to cope with war and recession at the same time...
example.tran: 这个行业以前从未有过必须同时应付战争和萧条的经历。

example.ex: She has had to cope with losing all her previous status and money.
example.tran: 她不得不忍受彻底失去以前所拥有的地位和金钱的痛苦。

value.tran: 应付，忍受(不愉快的局面)

value.def: If a machine or a system can cope with something, it is large enough or complex enough to deal with it satisfactorily.

example.ex: New blades have been designed to cope with the effects of dead insects...
example.tran: 新的桨片设计使其可以应付昆虫尸体带来的影响。

example.ex: The country's prisons are filled with drug-takers, and cannot cope with the numbers...
example.tran: 这个国家的监狱里挤满了瘾君子，都容纳不下了。

example.ex: The speed of economic change has been so great that the tax-collecting system has been unable to cope.
example.tran: 经济变化得如此之快，以致税收系统都应付不过来了。

value.def: A cope is a long sleeveless piece of clothing worn by some Christian priests on special occasions.
value.tran: (基督教牧师在特殊仪式中所穿的)长袍，法衣
